DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to examine if procalcitonin (PCT) can be used for early prediction of AKI septic patients in ICU.
DOC.brief_title: Serum Procalcitonin Level May Predict Acute Kidney Injury in ICU Patients With Sepsis
DOC.detailed_description: 67 patients with sepsis were enrolled in this study. On admission, PCT was measured together with serum creatinine, urea, and other inflammatory markers. Quick Sepsis-related Organ Failure Assessment was calculated at the emergency department. Patients were classified into those with Acute kidney injury (AKI) and non-AKI groups.
DOC.criteria: ICU patients with sepsis Patient known to have Endstage kidney disease Patients on Renal replacement therapy patients without procalcitonin level within 24 hours from admission.
